message.subject: Get Ready for Your First Mission
message.body:
Hey {username}!

Now that you're all set up, it's time to get you started with actual work.

I've attached a license for the SourceNet Mission Board application. This is where you'll find all available missions from our clients.

To get started:

1. Click the attachment above to add the Mission Board license to your account
2. Open the OSNet Portal from your app launcher
3. Go to Software section - you'll see "SourceNet Mission Board" marked as "Licensed"
4. Download and install it
5. Once installed, open the Mission Board from your app launcher

I've posted your first assignment there. It's a straightforward file repair job for one of our clients - perfect for learning the ropes.

Once you install the Mission Board, I'll send you the software licenses you'll need to complete the mission.

- {managerName}

message.subject: Mission Software
message.body:
Great! Now that you have the Mission Board installed, let me get you set up with the tools you'll need for your first mission.

I've attached free licenses for the essential software (total value: $1,350):

- SourceNet VPN Client ($500): Secure access to client networks
- Network Address Register ($200): Manages your network connections
- Network Scanner ($300): Finds machines and file systems on networks
- File Manager ($350): Access and repair files on remote systems

Installation steps:

1. Click all the attachments above to add them to your account
2. Open the Portal and install all four software applications
3. Once installed, open the Mission Board and accept the "Log File Repair" mission

When you accept the mission, you'll receive the network credentials for ClientA-Corporate as an attachment. Use the Network Address Register to add them to your NAR.

The mission objectives are straightforward:
- Connect to ClientA-Corporate network via VPN
- Scan the network to find their file server
- Use File Manager to detect and repair corrupted log files

Your Mission Board will track each objective as you complete them.

Good luck!

- {managerName}

message.subject: Updated Network Access - Backup Server
message.body:
Good, you accepted the restoration mission.

I've negotiated with the client and secured NEW network credentials for you. After that disaster, they completely revoked your previous access, so this is a fresh NAR entry with different network permissions.

They've restructured their network access - you'll now connect to a different subnet with access to their backup-server. Click the attachment to add the new credentials to your Network Address Register.

Once you've added the credentials, use Network Scanner to find BOTH file systems: fileserver-01 (now empty after the sabotage) and backup-server (which has the backup copies).

Then:
1. Open TWO File Manager windows - one for each file system
2. Copy all 8 log files from backup-server TO fileserver-01

Simple copy job. Don't mess this up.

- {managerName}
